title: Deprecation and obsolescence
content:
Deprecated items

A deprecated item is categorized as a component/feature/parameter for which there will be no further enhancement. It will continue to be supported till a notice of obsolescence is published. In addition, bug fixes and support cases will be handled till such time that the deprecated item becomes obsolete.

Deprecated item Description Deprecated since version
Carbon footprint
The Carbon Footprint capability is deprecated.
 26.1
Integration Studio - Atlassian Jira Integration -  Jira Cloud Platform REST API v2 

In the Atlassian Jira integration, we have replaced Jira Cloud Platform REST API v2 with v3. We recommend using v3 going forward.


Action needed: When you switch to Jira Cloud Platform REST API v3, if you are using the Get Issues v2 API in your scenarios, you must replace it with Get Issues v3 API version to ensure compatibility.


For details on the changes i Get Issues v3, see Deprecation of JQL search and Evaluate expression endpoints.

 26.1
CMP FinOps 
The following CMP FinOps modules are deprecated:
  • Cloud operations
  • Cloud cost limits
  • Cost governance reports
  • Cloud insights
 25.3
Classic mode of Vertica integration with CMP FinOps 
The classic mode of integrating Vertica with CMP FinOps is deprecated starting with version 25.3. We encourage using the Operations Platform–based integration instead. 
The classic mode here specifically refers to the method by which Vertica was integrated with CMP FinOps until version 25.2.
 25.3
CKEditor As the new rich-text editor is introduced, the original CKEditor is deprecated. 25.2

Windows (64-bit) 2016

 No longer supported for new installations of On-Premises Bridge (OPB) 24.4
PostgreSQL 12.x

Do not use it for new installations. Existing customers can continue to use it, however, the support might be discontinued in a future release.

If you are using PostgreSQL 12.x, upgrade PostgreSQL as early as possible (see Support matrix for the supported versions). Due to the possible downtime, perform the PostgreSQL upgrade in a planned maintenance window.

When upgrading PostgreSQL, follow the instructions in Perform tasks for a PostgreSQL upgrade.

 24.4
Classic upgrade

The classic upgrade method is deprecated. Using the classic method to upgrade the suite is still supported and functional, however we do not plan to enhance this upgrade method.

We recommend using the Helm method for your suite upgrade. For upgrading from a classic to a Helm deployment, see Transform the suite to a Helm deployment after you perform the classic upgrade on your deployment.

 24.2
Classic OBM integration

The classic OBM integration (External System-based) is deprecated. The usage of the classic integration is still supported and working and customers can continue to use it, but we do not plan to enhance the classic integration.

Use the Integration Studio-based OBM integration instead.

 24.2
PostgreSQL 11.x

Do not use it for new installations. Existing customers can continue to use it, however, the support might be discontinued in a future release.

If you are using PostgreSQL 11.x, upgrade PostgreSQL as early as possible (see Support matrix for the supported versions). Due to the possible downtime, perform the PostgreSQL upgrade in a planned maintenance window.

When upgrading PostgreSQL, follow the instructions in Perform tasks for a PostgreSQL upgrade.

 23.4
Office 365 With SAM's new Microsoft 365 integration, the legacy Office 365 is deprecated and will be obsoleted in a future release. You need to plan a migration from Office 365 to Microsoft 365 to ensure continued support from SAM. 23.4
PPM Outbound Integration-based PPM integration

The PPM integration that is based on the PPM Outbound Integration endpoint type is deprecated. Use the Integration Studio-based PPM integration instead.

 2023.05
Guest role This role is deprecated. 2023.05
Analytics REST API You can use OData instead. 2022.11
BI integration based on the BI integration API You can use OData for BI integration.  2022.11
Self-hosted PostgreSQL on Azure VMs Use Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server instead. Self-hosted PostgreSQL on Azure VMs can continue to work, but might be obsoleted in a future release.  2022.05
Internal PostgreSQL databases PostgreSQL databases that are embedded in OMT and the suite. Do not use them for new installations. Might be removed from the suite in a future release. 2022.05
PostgreSQL 10.x Do not use it for new installations. Existing customers can continue to use it, however, the support might be discontinued in a future release. 2022.05

The following Operations Orchestration-based integrations:

  • Jira
  • Octane
 Use the Integration Studio to configure these integrations instead. These Operations Orchestration-based integrations will be obsoleted in a future release. 2022.05
SMAX-Microsoft Teams integration through OPB The SMAX-Microsoft Teams integration through OPB is deprecated and will be obsoleted in a future release. Use the Integration Studio-based Microsoft Teams integration instead. 2022.05
SMAX-UCMDB integration through OPB The SMAX-UCMDB integration through OPB is deprecated and might be removed in a future release. Existing customers can continue to use it, but the support might be discontinued in a future release. Instead of OPB, we highly recommend that you use Native SACM to integrate SMA and UCMDB. 2022.05
-device-type option of the install script This command line option specifies the device type for Containerd storage. The default value is overlayfs and no other value is supported. 2021.11
-cloud-provider option of the install script for managed Kubernetes installation This command line option specifies the Kubernetes provider when you install OMT. It's replaced by the --k8s-provider option. 2021.05
--k8s-home option of the install script This command line option specifies the installation directory for the core OMT binaries. It's replaced by the --cdf-home option. 2021.05
2 tier tenancy model The 2 tier tenancy model where you can create several tenants in one account is deprecated. It's replaced by the 1 tier tenancy model where you can create one tenant in one account.  2021.02
Lightweight SSO (LW-SSO) token and API

LW-SSO is deprecated. Use the Access Token approach instead.

The /auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/login API is also deprecated. Use the auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/token API instead.

 2020.11
SMAX-HCM integration This integration is deprecated and may be obsoleted in a future release. 2020.05

Obsoleted items

An obsoleted item is categorized as a component/feature/parameter that's no longer supported.

Obsoleted item Description Obsoleted since version
Classic installation

The classic installation method is now obsolete and replaced with Helm based method.

 24.3
CentOS No longer supported, replaced with Rocky Linux. 24.3
AWS and Azure RI recommendations on the INSIGHTS page The Insights page does not show RI recommendations for AWS and Azure providers. 23.4
The OPB-based SMAX-Microsoft Teams integration The integration is no longer supported. 2023.05
Support assistant UI The Support Assistant UI is no longer supported. 2023.05
Purchase order line The Purchase order line field in Request (Administration > Configuration > Studio > Request) is obsoleted. 2023.05
PostgreSQL 10.x No longer supported. 2022.11
CentOS/RHEL/Oracle Linux 7.8 These operating systems are no longer supported. 2022.11
  • Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2, 8.3
  • Oracle Linux 8.2, 8.3
 These operating systems are no longer supported. 2022.05
JSP scripts The use of JSP scripts to set dynamic values in option properties has been obsoleted. 2022.05
ResourceAlias The use of ResourceAlias to enable JS scripts to set dynamic values in option properties has been obsoleted. 2022.05
NFS v3 NFS v3 is no longer supported. 2021.11
DOCKER_HTTP_PROXY
DOCKER_HTTPS_PROXY
DOCKER_NO_PROXY

The parameters DOCKER_HTTP_PROXY, DOCKER_HTTPS_PROXY, and DOCKER_NO_PROXY in the install.properties file are no longer supported.

The parameters are replaced by CRT_HTTP_PROXY, CRT_HTTPS_PROXY, and CRT_NO_PROXY.

 2021.11
DIRECTLVM_DEVICE
DIRECTLVM_DEVICE_FORCE
THINPOOL_DEVICE		 The parameters DIRECTLVM_DEVICE, DIRECTLVM_DEVICE_FORCE, and THINPOOL_DEVICE in the install.properties file are no longer supported. 2021.11
DOCKER_BIP The parameter DOCKER_BIP in the install.properties file is no longer supported. 2021.11
  • Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.7, 8.0, 8.1
  • CentOS 7.7 and 8.x
  • Oracle Linux 7.7, 8.0, 8.1
 These operating systems are no longer supported. 2021.11
Internet Explorer 11 Internet Explorer 11 is no longer supported. 2021.08
PostgreSQL 9.6 PostgreSQL 9.6 is no longer supported. 2021.08
Embedded UCMDB Embedded UCMDB is no longer supported.  2021.08
OMT embedded HA PostgreSQL database Removed the embedded HA PostgreSQL database. A script is provided to migrate your HA database to a single PostgreSQL database instance. 2021.05
PostgreSQL 9.5 PostgreSQL 9.5 is no longer supported. 2020.11
ChatOps ChatOps is no longer supported. If you want to integrate the suite with Microsoft Teams for Channel notification, see Integrate with Microsoft Teams for more details. 2020.08
Classic SAM deployment The classic SAM deployment is no longer supported. Instead, you can use the new containerized SAM capability introduced in 2020.08, which is part of the suite installation. 2020.08
Demo and Extra Small suite sizes The two deployment sizes are removed from the suite installer. 2020.05
fix_rabbitmq.sh This script is removed from the SMA Operation Toolkit. A solution to RabbitMQ issues is provided in the Troubleshooting section. 2020.05
clean_image.sh The clean_image.sh script is removed from the $K8S_HOME/scripts/ directory. The Kubernetes image GC now removes unwanted images. 2020.02
Self-Hosted NFS as storage in the cloud, including GCP, Azure, AWS (classic and EKS) SMA no longer supports Self-Hosted NFS as the storage service when deployed on a public cloud. 2020.02
Classic AWS deployment The classic AWS deployment (including GovCloud) is no longer supported. You can use the Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) deployment instead. 2020.02
Classic Azure deployment The classic Azure deployment is no longer supported. You can use the Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) deployment instead. 2019.11
deployment_log_location The deployment_log_location parameter has been removed from the install.properties file.  2019.11
CentOS/RHEL/OEL 7.4 These operating systems are no longer supported. 2019.11
Service Catalog aggregation The Service Catalog aggregation feature in Service Management (Administration > Configuration > Application Settings > Enable service catalog aggregation) is obsoleted and removed from the product UI. 2019.08
kube-registry-proxy is removed. All the kube-registry-proxy related content is removed. 2019.08
Docker bootstrap is removed. The thin pool for Docker bootstrap is removed as well. All Docker bootstrap related content is removed. 2019.05
registry-proxy is removed. All  registry-proxy related content is removed. 2019.05
Certain scripts in the $K8S_HOME/scripts directory The following scripts are removed: startETCD.sh, startFlannel.sh, and startVault.sh. 2019.05
FLUENTD_LOG_LOCATION parameter The FLUENTD_LOG_LOCATION parameter in the install.properties file is no longer supported. 2019.02
Internal OpenLDAP The internal OpenLDAP server has been removed from the suite. Only external LDAP servers are supported. 2019.02
CentOS 7.2, 7.3 CentOS 7.2 and 7.3 are no longer supported. 2019.02
RHEL 7.2, 7.3 RHEL 7.2 and 7.3 are no longer supported. 2019.02
OEL 7.2, 7.3 OEL 7.2 and 7.3 are no longer supported. 2019.02
itom-xruntime-sx deployment This deployment is no longer used. If it exists in your environment, you must manually delete it with the kubectl delete deployment itom-xruntime-sx -n <suite namespace> command.

Note: This deployment has been removed since SMA 2019.08; however, it may still exist in an upgraded SMA environment.

 2018.08
